20  package org.elasticsearch.indices.cache.query;
21  
22  import com.carrotsearch.hppc.ObjectOpenHashSet;
23  import com.carrotsearch.hppc.ObjectSet;
24  import com.google.common.cache.Cache;
25  import com.google.common.cache.CacheBuilder;
26  import com.google.common.cache.RemovalListener;
27  import com.google.common.cache.RemovalNotification;
28  import com.google.common.cache.Weigher;
29  
30  import org.apache.lucene.index.DirectoryReader;
31  import org.apache.lucene.index.IndexReader;
32  import org.apache.lucene.util.Accountable;
33  import org.apache.lucene.util.RamUsageEstimator;
34  import org.elasticsearch.ElasticsearchIllegalArgumentException;
35  import org.elasticsearch.action.search.SearchType;
36  import org.elasticsearch.cluster.ClusterService;
37  import org.elasticsearch.cluster.metadata.IndexMetaData;
38  import org.elasticsearch.common.bytes.BytesReference;
39  import org.elasticsearch.common.component.AbstractComponent;
40  import org.elasticsearch.common.inject.Inject;
41  import org.elasticsearch.common.io.stream.BytesStreamOutput;
42  import org.elasticsearch.common.settings.Settings;
43  import org.elasticsearch.common.unit.MemorySizeValue;
44  import org.elasticsearch.common.unit.TimeValue;
45  import org.elasticsearch.common.util.concurrent.ConcurrentCollections;
46  import org.elasticsearch.common.util.concurrent.EsRejectedExecutionException;
47  import org.elasticsearch.index.shard.IndexShard;
48  import org.elasticsearch.index.shard.IndexShardState;
49  import org.elasticsearch.search.internal.SearchContext;
50  import org.elasticsearch.search.internal.ShardSearchRequest;
51  import org.elasticsearch.search.query.QueryPhase;
52  import org.elasticsearch.search.query.QuerySearchResult;
53  import org.elasticsearch.threadpool.ThreadPool;
54  
55  import java.util.Collection;
56  import java.util.Collections;
57  import java.util.Iterator;
58  import java.util.Set;
59  import java.util.concurrent.Callable;
60  import java.util.concurrent.ConcurrentMap;
61  import java.util.concurrent.TimeUnit;
62  
63  import static org.elasticsearch.common.Strings.hasLength;
64  
65  /**
66   * The indices query cache allows to cache a shard level query stage responses, helping with improving
67   * similar requests that are potentially expensive (because of aggs for example). The cache is fully coherent
68   * with the semantics of NRT (the index reader version is part of the cache key), and relies on size based
69   * eviction to evict old reader associated cache entries as well as scheduler reaper to clean readers that
70   * are no longer used or closed shards.
71   * <p/>
72   * Currently, the cache is only enabled for {@link SearchType#COUNT}, and can only be opted in on an index
73   * level setting that can be dynamically changed and defaults to false.
74   * <p/>
75   * There are still several TODOs left in this class, some easily addressable, some more complex, but the support
76   * is functional.
77   */
78  public class IndicesQueryCache extends AbstractComponent implements RemovalListener<IndicesQueryCache.Key, IndicesQueryCache.Value> {
79  
80      /**
81       * A setting to enable or disable query caching on an index level. Its dynamic by default
82       * since we are checking on the cluster state IndexMetaData always.
83       */
84      public static final String INDEX_CACHE_QUERY_ENABLED = "index.cache.query.enable";
85      public static final String INDICES_CACHE_QUERY_CLEAN_INTERVAL = "indices.cache.query.clean_interval";
86  
87      public static final String INDICES_CACHE_QUERY_SIZE = "indices.cache.query.size";
88      public static final String INDICES_CACHE_QUERY_EXPIRE = "indices.cache.query.expire";
89      public static final String INDICES_CACHE_QUERY_CONCURRENCY_LEVEL = "indices.cache.query.concurrency_level";
90  
91      private final ThreadPool threadPool;
92      private final ClusterService clusterService;
93  
94      private final TimeValue cleanInterval;
95      private final Reaper reaper;
96  
97      final ConcurrentMap<CleanupKey, Boolean> registeredClosedListeners = ConcurrentCollections.newConcurrentMap();
98      final Set<CleanupKey> keysToClean = ConcurrentCollections.newConcurrentSet();
99  
100 
101     //TODO make these changes configurable on the cluster level
102     private final String size;
103     private final TimeValue expire;
104     private final int concurrencyLevel;
105 
106     private volatile Cache<Key, Value> cache;
107 
108     @Inject
109     public IndicesQueryCache(Settings settings, ClusterService clusterService, ThreadPool threadPool) {
110         super(settings);
111         this.clusterService = clusterService;
112         this.threadPool = threadPool;
113         this.cleanInterval = settings.getAsTime(INDICES_CACHE_QUERY_CLEAN_INTERVAL, TimeValue.timeValueSeconds(60));
114         // this cache can be very small yet still be very effective
115         this.size = settings.get(INDICES_CACHE_QUERY_SIZE, "1%");
116         this.expire = settings.getAsTime(INDICES_CACHE_QUERY_EXPIRE, null);
117         // defaults to 4, but this is a busy map for all indices, increase it a bit by default
118         this.concurrencyLevel =  settings.getAsInt(INDICES_CACHE_QUERY_CONCURRENCY_LEVEL, 16);
119         if (concurrencyLevel <= 0) {
120             throw new ElasticsearchIllegalArgumentException("concurrency_level must be > 0 but was: " + concurrencyLevel);
121         }
122         buildCache();
123 
124         this.reaper = new Reaper();
125         threadPool.schedule(cleanInterval, ThreadPool.Names.SAME, reaper);
126     }
127 
128     private void buildCache() {
129         long sizeInBytes = MemorySizeValue.parseBytesSizeValueOrHeapRatio(size).bytes();
130 
131         CacheBuilder<Key, Value> cacheBuilder = CacheBuilder.newBuilder()
132                 .maximumWeight(sizeInBytes).weigher(new QueryCacheWeigher()).removalListener(this);
133         cacheBuilder.concurrencyLevel(concurrencyLevel);
134 
135         if (expire != null) {
136             cacheBuilder.expireAfterAccess(expire.millis(), TimeUnit.MILLISECONDS);
137         }
138 
139         cache = cacheBuilder.build();
140     }
141 
142     private static class QueryCacheWeigher implements Weigher<Key, Value> {
143 
144         @Override
145         public int weigh(Key key, Value value) {
146             return (int) (key.ramBytesUsed() + value.ramBytesUsed());
147         }
148     }
149 
150     public void close() {
151         reaper.close();
152         cache.invalidateAll();
153     }
154 
155     public void clear(IndexShard shard) {
156         if (shard == null) {
157             return;
158         }
159         keysToClean.add(new CleanupKey(shard, -1));
160         logger.trace("{} explicit cache clear", shard.shardId());
161         reaper.reap();
162     }
163 
164     @Override
165     public void onRemoval(RemovalNotification<Key, Value> notification) {
166         if (notification.getKey() == null) {
167             return;
168         }
169         notification.getKey().shard.queryCache().onRemoval(notification);
170     }
171 
172     /**
173      * Can the shard request be cached at all?
174      */
175     public boolean canCache(ShardSearchRequest request, SearchContext context) {
176         // TODO: for now, template is not supported, though we could use the generated bytes as the key
177         if (hasLength(request.templateSource())) {
178             return false;
179         }
180         // for now, only enable it for search type count
181         if (context.searchType() != SearchType.COUNT) {
182             return false;
183         }
184         IndexMetaData index = clusterService.state().getMetaData().index(request.index());
185         if (index == null) { // in case we didn't yet have the cluster state, or it just got deleted
186             return false;
187         }
188         // if not explicitly set in the request, use the index setting, if not, use the request
189         if (request.queryCache() == null) {
190             if (!index.settings().getAsBoolean(INDEX_CACHE_QUERY_ENABLED, Boolean.FALSE)) {
191                 return false;
192             }
193         } else if (!request.queryCache()) {
194             return false;
195         }
196         // if the reader is not a directory reader, we can't get the version from it
197         if (!(context.searcher().getIndexReader() instanceof DirectoryReader)) {
198             return false;
199         }
200         // if now in millis is used (or in the future, a more generic "isDeterministic" flag
201         // then we can't cache based on "now" key within the search request, as it is not deterministic
202         if (context.nowInMillisUsed()) {
203             return false;
204         }
205         return true;
206     }
207 
208     /**
209      * Loads the cache result, computing it if needed by executing the query phase and otherwise deserializing the cached
210      * value into the {@link SearchContext#queryResult() context's query result}. The combination of load + compute allows
211      * to have a single load operation that will cause other requests with the same key to wait till its loaded an reuse
212      * the same cache.
213      */
214     public void loadIntoContext(final ShardSearchRequest request, final SearchContext context, final QueryPhase queryPhase) throws Exception {
215         assert canCache(request, context);
216         Key key = buildKey(request, context);
217         Loader loader = new Loader(queryPhase, context, key);
218         Value value = cache.get(key, loader);
219         if (loader.isLoaded()) {
220             key.shard.queryCache().onMiss();
221             // see if its the first time we see this reader, and make sure to register a cleanup key
222             CleanupKey cleanupKey = new CleanupKey(context.indexShard(), ((DirectoryReader) context.searcher().getIndexReader()).getVersion());
223             if (!registeredClosedListeners.containsKey(cleanupKey)) {
224                 Boolean previous = registeredClosedListeners.putIfAbsent(cleanupKey, Boolean.TRUE);
225                 if (previous == null) {
226                     context.searcher().getIndexReader().addReaderClosedListener(cleanupKey);
227                 }
228             }
229         } else {
230             key.shard.queryCache().onHit();
231             // restore the cached query result into the context
232             final QuerySearchResult result = context.queryResult();
233             result.readFromWithId(context.id(), value.reference.streamInput());
234             result.shardTarget(context.shardTarget());
235         }
236     }
237 
238     private static class Loader implements Callable<Value> {
239 
240         private final QueryPhase queryPhase;
241         private final SearchContext context;
242         private final IndicesQueryCache.Key key;
243         private boolean loaded;
244 
245         Loader(QueryPhase queryPhase, SearchContext context, IndicesQueryCache.Key key) {
246             this.queryPhase = queryPhase;
247             this.context = context;
248             this.key = key;
249         }
250 
251         public boolean isLoaded() {
252             return this.loaded;
253         }
254 
255         @Override
256         public Value call() throws Exception {
257             queryPhase.execute(context);
258 
259             /* BytesStreamOutput allows to pass the expected size but by default uses
260              * BigArrays.PAGE_SIZE_IN_BYTES which is 16k. A common cached result ie.
261              * a date histogram with 3 buckets is ~100byte so 16k might be very wasteful
262              * since we don't shrink to the actual size once we are done serializing.
263              * By passing 512 as the expected size we will resize the byte array in the stream
264              * slowly until we hit the page size and don't waste too much memory for small query
265              * results.*/
266             final int expectedSizeInBytes = 512;
267             try (BytesStreamOutput out = new BytesStreamOutput(expectedSizeInBytes)) {
268                 context.queryResult().writeToNoId(out);
269                 // for now, keep the paged data structure, which might have unused bytes to fill a page, but better to keep
270                 // the memory properly paged instead of having varied sized bytes
271                 final BytesReference reference = out.bytes();
272                 loaded = true;
273                 Value value = new Value(reference, out.ramBytesUsed());
274                 key.shard.queryCache().onCached(key, value);
275                 return value;
276             }
277         }
278     }
279 
280     public static class Value implements Accountable {
281         final BytesReference reference;
282         final long ramBytesUsed;
283 
284         public Value(BytesReference reference, long ramBytesUsed) {
285             this.reference = reference;
286             this.ramBytesUsed = ramBytesUsed;
287         }
288 
289         @Override
290         public long ramBytesUsed() {
291             return ramBytesUsed;
292         }
293 
294         @Override
295         public Collection<Accountable> getChildResources() {
296             return Collections.emptyList();
297         }
298     }
299 
300     public static class Key implements Accountable {
301         public final IndexShard shard; // use as identity equality
302         public final long readerVersion; // use the reader version to now keep a reference to a "short" lived reader until its reaped
303         public final BytesReference value;
304 
305         Key(IndexShard shard, long readerVersion, BytesReference value) {
306             this.shard = shard;
307             this.readerVersion = readerVersion;
308             this.value = value;
309         }
310 
311         @Override
312         public long ramBytesUsed() {
313             return RamUsageEstimator.NUM_BYTES_OBJECT_REF + RamUsageEstimator.NUM_BYTES_LONG + value.length();
314         }
315 
316         @Override
317         public Collection<Accountable> getChildResources() {
318             // TODO: more detailed ram usage?
319             return Collections.emptyList();
320         }
321 
322         @Override
323         public boolean equals(Object o) {
324             if (this == o) return true;
325             Key key = (Key) o;
326             if (readerVersion != key.readerVersion) return false;
327             if (!shard.equals(key.shard)) return false;
328             if (!value.equals(key.value)) return false;
329             return true;
330         }
331 
332         @Override
333         public int hashCode() {
334             int result = shard.hashCode();
335             result = 31 * result + (int) (readerVersion ^ (readerVersion >>> 32));
336             result = 31 * result + value.hashCode();
337             return result;
338         }
339     }
340 
341     private class CleanupKey implements IndexReader.ReaderClosedListener {
342         IndexShard indexShard;
343         long readerVersion; // use the reader version to now keep a reference to a "short" lived reader until its reaped
344 
345         private CleanupKey(IndexShard indexShard, long readerVersion) {
346             this.indexShard = indexShard;
347             this.readerVersion = readerVersion;
348         }
349 
350         @Override
351         public void onClose(IndexReader reader) {
352             Boolean remove = registeredClosedListeners.remove(this);
353             if (remove != null) {
354                 keysToClean.add(this);
355             }
356         }
357 
358         @Override
359         public boolean equals(Object o) {
360             if (this == o) return true;
361             CleanupKey that = (CleanupKey) o;
362             if (readerVersion != that.readerVersion) return false;
363             if (!indexShard.equals(that.indexShard)) return false;
364             return true;
365         }
366 
367         @Override
368         public int hashCode() {
369             int result = indexShard.hashCode();
370             result = 31 * result + (int) (readerVersion ^ (readerVersion >>> 32));
371             return result;
372         }
373     }
374 
375     private class Reaper implements Runnable {
376 
377         private final ObjectSet<CleanupKey> currentKeysToClean = ObjectOpenHashSet.newInstance();
378         private final ObjectSet<IndexShard> currentFullClean = ObjectOpenHashSet.newInstance();
379 
380         private volatile boolean closed;
381 
382         void close() {
383             closed = true;
384         }
385 
386         @Override
387         public void run() {
388             if (closed) {
389                 return;
390             }
391             if (keysToClean.isEmpty()) {
392                 schedule();
393                 return;
394             }
395             try {
396                 threadPool.executor(ThreadPool.Names.GENERIC).execute(new Runnable() {
397                     @Override
398                     public void run() {
399                         reap();
400                         schedule();
401                     }
402                 });
403             } catch (EsRejectedExecutionException ex) {
404                 logger.debug("Can not run ReaderCleaner - execution rejected", ex);
405             }
406         }
407 
408         private void schedule() {
409             try {
410                 threadPool.schedule(cleanInterval, ThreadPool.Names.SAME, this);
411             } catch (EsRejectedExecutionException ex) {
412                 logger.debug("Can not schedule ReaderCleaner - execution rejected", ex);
413             }
414         }
415 
416         synchronized void reap() {
417             currentKeysToClean.clear();
418             currentFullClean.clear();
419             for (Iterator<CleanupKey> iterator = keysToClean.iterator(); iterator.hasNext(); ) {
420                 CleanupKey cleanupKey = iterator.next();
421                 iterator.remove();
422                 if (cleanupKey.readerVersion == -1 || cleanupKey.indexShard.state() == IndexShardState.CLOSED) {
423                     // -1 indicates full cleanup, as does a closed shard
424                     currentFullClean.add(cleanupKey.indexShard);
425                 } else {
426                     currentKeysToClean.add(cleanupKey);
427                 }
428             }
429 
430             if (!currentKeysToClean.isEmpty() || !currentFullClean.isEmpty()) {
431                 CleanupKey lookupKey = new CleanupKey(null, -1);
432                 for (Iterator<Key> iterator = cache.asMap().keySet().iterator(); iterator.hasNext(); ) {
433                     Key key = iterator.next();
434                     if (currentFullClean.contains(key.shard)) {
435                         iterator.remove();
436                     } else {
437                         lookupKey.indexShard = key.shard;
438                         lookupKey.readerVersion = key.readerVersion;
439                         if (currentKeysToClean.contains(lookupKey)) {
440                             iterator.remove();
441                         }
442                     }
443                 }
444             }
445 
446             cache.cleanUp();
447             currentKeysToClean.clear();
448             currentFullClean.clear();
449         }
450     }
451 
452     private static Key buildKey(ShardSearchRequest request, SearchContext context) throws Exception {
453         // TODO: for now, this will create different keys for different JSON order
454         // TODO: tricky to get around this, need to parse and order all, which can be expensive
455         return new Key(context.indexShard(),
456                 ((DirectoryReader) context.searcher().getIndexReader()).getVersion(),
457                 request.cacheKey());
458     }
459 }
